title: Karadzic Business Card
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121181914im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/_44855327_card226afp_4219.jpg)

 [‹ Fonts: Where to buy them? (I've got specifics that I need)](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121181914/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47797 "Go to previous forum topic") [Typo trip in Germany? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121181914/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47806 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Nick Shinn

comments.content: It’s hard to tell with the low resolution, but it looks like ∆ from the Greek alphabet has been used to replace the Д in Cyrillic Times, in imitation of the archaic triangular form of that letter, for a pyramid-power effect.
You’re right. His pseudonym was Dragan David Dabić, so D.D. Dabić -\> Д.Д. Дaбић. Even the last letter is replaced by ∆.
This business card was made in a copy machine ! : $ 9.99 for thousand .

Makes you really want to do business with that guy :-)

ChrisL
Actually, it says Д. Д. Давид (David), not Д. Д. Дaбић (Dabić). I can only assume Давид was chosen because of that extra pyramid-power д.
That card is a keeper, but I can’t pin down exactly where it is.

Yes, it’s David, as in the ’David Wellbeing Program’ as advertised on the website, which consists of wearing a special energy-alignment pendant around your neck. I suppose the intriguing question is whether Karadzić believed this stuff or simply saw it as another way to manipulate and exploit the gullible.

I read today that K is a genuine talent. His partner in practice was his discoverer, tested him and he scored extremely high (over 100% whatever that may mean). Apparantly he is a crack at finding water and energy disturbances, and attained the highest rank of general after five days’ training.  
And his neighbours loved the guy: very polite and friendly.

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO
